instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7012: What is D7012? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year model macbook airs, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.R7105: What is R7105? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DCIN Leakage
threads.message:
This board had liquid damage to the entire area DCIN/3v42 of this board: from <CAPACITOR>C7098</CAPACITOR>,L7095 area through <DIODE>D7012</DIODE>, ALL of those components have been replaced. This board boots from PS input but not from original 85W charger. 

On original charger:
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>  is around 1.5V most of the time
Diode mode there is 0.5
I've replace <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> twice, ISL twice, <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> 3x (last time I did <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> at same time as ISL just in case), Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> twice
Resistors i've checked that measure good: <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>/6, <RESISTOR>R7010</RESISTOR>/1/2, <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>/1/5/6, <RESISTOR>R7105</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7010</RESISTOR>/1
REsistance between pins 17/18 of ISL is 2.1 ohms,  27/28 pins 20 ohms.

Once briefly after replacing ISL the board started but I believe this was shortly after having on power supply so not sure if that was related.

Any thoughts? I feel like I've replaced everything I could think of for typical leakage cause at least once.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DCIN Leakage
threads.message:
Did you try known good LIO board/flex?
Check/replace <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR>/11.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DCIN Leakage
threads.message:
Those resistors are good as mentioned and yes, tried different DCIN boards.
Somehow I started getting intermittent board start up on original magsafe charger.
I changed the DCIN Port and <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR>. PPDCIN is consistently 16.8V now but PPBUS G3H is consistently low 1.1V

ISL:
1- 0V
2 - 16.5V
3 - 4V
6- 0V
9- 0V
12- 3.4V
13- 3.4V
14- 3.4V
17- 1.1V
27- 1.1V

Same REsistance between pins 17/18 of ISL is 2.1 ohms, 27/28 pins 20 ohms. I changed ISL again and same results.

diode at PPBUS G3H is .138

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DCIN Leakage
threads.message:
Change <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and be sure <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> is good.

You've forgot to mention voltage on pins 15, 19, 20.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DCIN Leakage
threads.message:
Well there previously must have been multiple issues remaining but I ended up replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> for the 4th time and all is good. Unfortunately I don't know what the other problem that got solved ultimately got the board working. Must've been something that was blowing the <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>'s that I eventually replaced. 

This one was a nightmare so not worth fixing but I can't NOT fix a charging issue haha!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DCIN Leakage
threads.message: Be aware of recovered <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>; use new ones.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DCIN Leakage
threads.message: Ahhhhhh... maybe that's what it was? I harvested off boards with non-charging issues but I will order new. Not worth beating my head against a bench for 3 hours over a $50 board haaha
